name: guidelines
description: List of cross-cutting Global Guidelines for the task, each tagged with a guideline type and written as a concise declarative statement.

tasks.name: type
tasks.description: Guideline category label indicating the role of this guideline.

class_definitions.principle: Fundamental, must-follow rules that apply across all decisions and outputs.
class_definitions.preference: Soft preferences used to break ties between multiple valid outputs.
class_definitions.consistency: Guidance on staying uniform across examples, annotators, and time.
class_definitions.ambiguity: Policies for handling unclear, incomplete, or borderline inputs or cases.
class_definitions.tradeoff: Global rules for handling trade-offs (e.g., precision vs recall, coverage vs strictness).
class_definitions.style: Guidance on tone, phrasing, determinism, and overall output style.
class_definitions.pitfall: Common mistakes and failure modes to be aware of and avoid.
class_definitions.other: Any other cross-cutting guideline that does not fit the above categories.

tasks.name: content
tasks.description: One concise guideline sentence or short paragraph, expressed in neutral declarative form and applying across the entire task.

name: missing_info
description: Plain-text description of missing information, open questions, or ambiguities that need to be resolved to fully specify the Global Guidelines. If nothing important is missing, respond with a short explicit statement such as 'None'.
